abstract.p: Jennifer Lanthier letter on January 9 article about pessismists says that study participants are not pessismists, but realists

block.p: Re ''Yet Another Worry for Those Who Believe the Glass Is Half-Empty'' (Jan. 9): So, a Dutch study found pessimists were ''more likely to die of heart disease and other causes'' than optimists. And Dr. Richard A. Friedman's essay -- understandably -- focused on whether pessimism triggered the higher mortality rate. But as a layperson I found myself wondering whether it would make more sense to simply relabel each participant in the study. I would dub them all realists.
